# Minimum Acceptable Diet (MAD)

``` {r, echo = FALSE}
knitr::include_graphics(rep("images/construction.png"))
```



This document contains the minimum elements required to collect data for the SPR
indicator “Minimum Acceptable Diet”. Minimum Acceptable Diet (MAD) is part of the compendium of
indicators used internationally to measure Infant and Young Child Feeding (IYCF) Practices, developed
and recommended by UNICEF and WHO. It is an indicator widely used in health and nutrition surveys to
identify the proportion of children (aged 6 to 23 months) who consumed a minimum acceptable diet.
